Description: At top 40 guitarsour customers satisfaction is our first concern.All of out items have a 14 day return policy.If after 14 days you are not completely satisfiedwith your purchase, please return it for a full refund....Peace be with you... *all returned items must be in the same condition theywere at the time of sale. All original packing must be included. #5728 Up for Sale is aVintage 1954 Gretsch 6186 Clipper Hollywood! Original Hi' Lo Tron Pickup! Made In USA! This is really cool. You are looking at a Vintage 1954 Gretsch 6186 Clipper Hollywood Hollow Body Archtop. This was the entry level Gretsch at that time. If a White Falcon was a Cadillac, the Clipper Hollywood was a Corolla. Paired with original chrome G pointer knobs and a slender 1 3/4" body depth, this Clipper is a simple, straightforward, and surprisingly versatile vintage Gretsch. The tone is spanky and clear acoustically, and through the pickup there's a distinct twang to the top end and sweetness to the lows. The neck has a medium C shaped profile with a thick slab Brazilian rosewood fretboard, and original frets which are in excellent shape. The stock frets have plenty of meat and height left with well rounded crowns and virtually no wear. The bone nut measures a full 1 11/16" in width and the headstock retains the original truss rod cover, "Gretsch" waterslide decal, and stock open gear tuning machines. These tuners turn smoothly, and hold pitch as they should. The simple electronics work well, and a pair of original Gretsch G pointer knobs. The original floating compensated bridge, chrome Gretsch tailpiece, and pickguard are present as well.The original Gretsch hardshell case with blue/gray speckled exterior is included. Even a original hang tag (case candy) is included. Our luthier did a complete setup. Brand new strings were installed. Gig ready on Arrival! Serial Number: #11721 Nut Width: 1.67" Weight: 6.75 lbs. Complete Package with Original Gretsch Case and Case Candy Included! Due to CITES Treaty for Endangered Wood (Mahogany, Rosewood) We no longer ship out of the USA. Cosmetics: Good "Relic" Condition. Not for the faint-hearted. This is the "Real Deal" There are scuffs, scratches, chips dings and dents on both sides of the body. The binding has yellowed and is missing and crumbled in some places. Our luthier re-attached the binding. Everything is just solid and tight. Cool wear marks on the body. Lacquer checking on both sides of the guitar. Neck heel is missing some of the binding. Neck & Headstock has some scratches and dings. Fretboard in good shape. Case has scuffs, scratches and tears in the tolex. All latches work. Very Authentic. Dripping with "Mojo" Look at the pictures closely. They will tell the story. Top 40 guitars is a Veteran owned business.
